data.title: Interview with John Conyers
data.text:
Description

Interview with John Conyers conducted for Eyes on the Prize II. Discussion centers labor unions, the rebellion and civil unrest known as the Detroit riots of 1967, the Gary National Black Political Convention, the Congressional Black Caucus, President Richard M. Nixon, and Fred Hampton.

Funder

Thanks to a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH), the original 16mm negative film were scanned and digitized to create 2K DPX files and the original 1/4" elements were digitized to create 24-bit 96kHz .wav files. The picture and audio were then reassembled at the Film & Media Archive.
